name: Capitoline Wolf
description:
[Cut & Sew Hoody]

Black/Grey

 "The legend of  Romulus and Remus is pretty dear to a lot of people. The original idea for the design was to simple put the statue on a crew-neck and call it a day. But I discovered a story of twin brothers that  were taken care of by a she-wolf. As the legend goes... They became the fathers of Rome. I was on the phone with Kevin Sinatra, when I thought about different prints and he said something like 'Bro I need a fur coat.' DING! The idea went off in my head and I literally came up with the design on the spot. It is the only hoody in this collection & I am sure people will respond to it."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Roma Victor.
description:
[Cut & Sew Long Sleeve Tee]

Black/Grey/White 

"I never really understood why people didn't use fur prints before. Or maybe they did & we do it so much better that its not even worth mentioning. Either way this piece is parallel with the Capitoline Wolf hoody. I believe that if you like something as a hoody, yo could possibly like it as a tee shirt. If you don't like it as a tee shirt, then you could possibly like it as a hoody. When you put words on sleeves they better be something that people would want to rep. Who wouldn't want to rep 'ROMA VICTOR'? Who doesn't want to share the glory ROME?" 

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Constantinus.
description:
[Cut & Sew piece]

Long sleeve / Extension Tee. 
Black/ Silver

"I went through so many Emperors in my pursuit to find the perfect balance for Rome. In actuality I feel upon photos of the Archs of Constantine, before I found any actual information on what an amazing emperor he is. Rather than take something random out of the public domain, I actually had permission from the photographer who took the picture. Another thing that people may notice is that this piece is an 'extendo' piece. I know that trends in fashion are a dime a dozen and they come and go, but I figure that this was an opportunity to walk the plank. I fell in love with the sample and just couldn't resist. I just hope one day I can have a memorial as decadent as Constantine has in Europe."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: GLORY!
description:
[Cut & Sew Crewneck]

Black/Grey/Beige

"Everything was getting very very dull in our collection. I mean like borrrrrrrrrrrring. So it was time to make something that was arrogant, that demanded you to stare at it no matter how you feel about it. You can think it is the ugliest thing you have ever seen, but I guarantee that you won't forget the fact that you saw it. The original idea was a little too eccentric for me. Chris really went avant garde. Once sat down and actually decided to collaborate on the piece, we realized that the making Constantine & Glory matching pieces, could go a lot further than just making a super complicated piece. We used pictures from a chapel. We used the Archs of Constantine. We tried to mesh something together that screams at you no matter how you feel about it!"

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: HOMME : Warhol/Caesar
description:
100& Organic Cotton
100& American Made

White/Black/Grey/Orange

"I developed a new theme. I want to compare two people that don't have anything to do with each other. I like to think of myself as the leader of this brand. As the visionary. The one that wants to conquer everything. I consider Chris to be the artistic genius. He is the Warhol of this collective. You put both of us together you get Swavor. So this artwork is actually a representation of Chris & I. I just figured I had a better chance of people responding with a pic of these two than a pic of me & him.

The reason for the HOMME is to try and broaden the perspective. Homme means 'man' in French. a lot of time creatives are the artists and not visionaries business wise. When you can be both, you become the Steve Jobs' , the Jay-Z's and the Diddy's. I believe that is the ultimate example of the perfect man. If you can be both creative and have the business etiquette, then you are in a class all by yourself."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Face Off: Warhol/Caesar [Black]
description:
100& Organic Cotton
100& American Made

Black/Grey/Orange

"I developed a new theme. I want to compare two people that don't have anything to do with each other. I like to think of myself as the leader of this brand. As the visionary. The one that wants to conquer everything. I consider Chris to be the artistic genius. He is the Warhol of this collective. You put both of us together you get Swavor. So this artwork is actually a representation of Chris & I. I just figured I had a better chance of people responding with a pic of these two than a pic of me & him."

Creative Director 
Shek Tarawallie

name: 'Warhol Meets Ceasar' by Christofer Brito
description:
[Cut and Sew Crew-Neck]

Black/Grey

"What would happen if Andy Warhol made a piece with this statue?" I can only speculate that was the mentality when Chris was creating this piece. The irony is that we wanted to modernize Rome a bit. Warhol has been a guy that both Chris and I admire. He is just one of those polarizing art figures that's pieces never go unnoticed. In a nutshell, Chris 'Warholed' a  Julius Caesar statue in honor of Warhol. Through the eyes of Warhol. In rememberance of them both. "

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: POWER
description:
Long Sleeve Tee Shirt
100% Organic Cotton. 
100% American Made.

"There are a couple moments in my life in where I knew things would never be the same for me. The first time I heard POWER by Kanye West, I knew it was one of those times. This was one of the first pieces that we made for the collection. All great empires demonstrate their power over the course of their reign. Its simple. Nothing more nothing less. It is bold and sudden."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Lion's Den
description:
[Cut and Sew Long Sleeve Tee]

Black/Grey/Tan 

"We have made similar piece to this one in all honesty. The first time might have been last fall. The background picture is actually a Mosaic of a man throwing someone else into a lions den. I think this is pretty symbolic in terms of life in America. We are in an era where everything around us is becoming more uncertain. I can wake up today and lose everything and I am basically that guy getting thrown into a lions den. I take hope from this piece. I take courage from this piece. I hope that day never happens, but I am aware that it can and that is what this piece is about."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Coin.
description:
[Cut & Sew Long Sleeve Tee]

Black/Grey

"I think that we are way passed the era of using money on clothing. Nothing says the mid/early 2000s like shirt with screen sprinted money on it. However, nothing quite beats having the something timeless on a shirt. Finding vintage Roman coins are something to brag about. Due to their rarity and their cultural impact. I want this piece to have the same essence. I want you to feel like you are collecting a piece of cultural relevancy. Initially Chris presented three of these to me. The other two could pop on in a later collection...or make an appearance in Part II."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Vase.
description:
[Cut & Sew Long Sleeve Tee]

Swavor Blue/Grey

"I jut remember watching a documentary on Rome with Chris via Skype. Like usually when we are doing something as big as Rome we want to be as historically accurate as possible. So we are like 10 mins in and they are doing a dramatic slow-mo through some type of museum. This man Chris just starts getting super antsy. He stops the video and won't shut up about the art on this vase. So from the little excerpt screenshot, this kid recreates the ENTIRE design on the vase from scratch. Its an amazing piece and definitely a defining moment in Chris' artistry."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Mercy.
description:
[Cut & Sew Tee Shirt] 

Black/Burgundy/Brown

"I remember watching Gladiator and thinking 'How the hell did Ridley Scott come up with this shit?" With a little research, I found out that when he got the script for Gladiator he couldn't picture it perfectly. Like he couldn't quite get the gladiator, like it didn't quite make sense to him. 'Pollice Verso' by Jean-Léon Gérôme gave hime all the clarity he needed. In reality this maybe the most important piece of the collection. Without this painting, there would be no Gladiator, with no Gladiator, there would be no collection like this. So in reality...I have Jean-Léon Gérôme to thank for the future success of this collection."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Comodous' Armor.
description:
[Cut & Sew piece]

Beige/Cream/White

"I just think that you can take a lot of good from anything that is bad. So when Commodous was being a little bitch in Gladiator, there was a very very big upside. He was wearing majestic armour in that final scene. I just remember looking at him like...'Yo Commodous is a bitch but man he is fly as hell right now.' So I basically wanted to reenact that armor that he was wearing. It took a while to try and get it as accurate as possible, but Chris is a wizard when it comes to articulating my ideas.So we definitely got it done."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: Shek vs. Tisci
description:
[Cut & Sew Tee-Shirt]

'David with the Head of Goliath' 
 by Caravaggio.

Black/Beige/Brown 

"There comes a time in every artists' mind when they feel they are either not talented enough or that they are not getting their just-do for their talent. I believe both Chris & I are in that latter phase. I want everyone to know that we are David in this painting. You can take your pick on who you want to be Goliath in this painting. Louis Vuitton, Givenchy, Prada, Supreme, any brand that is 'above us now, will suffer the same fate that Goliath did. It is only a matter of time. It may not be tomorrow or next week or next year, but before my time is done, we will dethrone all of the people we look up to now."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: The End.
description:
[Cut & Sew Crew-Neck]


White/Black

 "They say all things come to an end, the Roman Empire was no different. I just remember looking at all the symbols of Rome and was just thinking 'Wow all of this imploded'. So that was my philosophy when I was designing the piece. The execution of course made everything all the more difficult. This piece is cut and sew and we used dye sublimation to get the design correct. Ink doesn't listen to human beings. It does whatever it wants. But eventually we got it right. This piece puts into perspective that all things come to an end."

Creative Director
Shek Tarawallie

name: S.P.Q.R (BLACK)
description:
S.P.Q.R (trans. The Senate & the People of Rome) zipper tee.

Handmade/Cut & Sew. 

"Its amazing actually gazing through these pictures just to see how these tees actually came into fruition. We wanted to completely shift focus and have a big distance in between our Spring collection and this one. So we went under into Pre-fall intermission. With speculation that we were going out of business. In reality we were just planning to get everything right. 

The original sample for this piece was a tragic. When I received it, Chris & I instantly went to work and corrected the design that day! These  final pieces however are beautiful . We didn't go overboard with the zipper trend. And may have introduced a new trend to the world, 'The Marble Print'. We kept it very moderate & still took it to another level. Now fast forward our initial model ditching us on the day of the shoot, us finding a random guy to model in the middle of DC, the Complex Magazine lookbook debut & KickkSpott selling out their stock in this collection, you have us. Two guys who went through more for a three-piece collection than any collection before. All for the glory of Rome. All to share that glory with all of you.

When the Romans would throw Christians into the Gladiators den, they would make them wear the letters 'SPQR' on the front of their attire. The Christians in return added the cross to the end of it, to make it look like 'SPQRt' . This is the root of the word, 'Sport' . Which is why we used Rome as the theme of this collection. Its influence reigns over all of us. In the architecture , the language and the government. In an era where countries are trying to establish dominance, let us remember that no empire will ever have the influence of Rome. "

- Creative Director, Shek Tarawallie

(Excerpt from interview)

- Handmade.
- 100% Poly-Twill .
- Zipper is 7 inches.
- Dry-Clean or Cold wash.
 
Designed by Shek Tarawallie & Christofer Brito. 
Photos by An Dukes.

name: S.P.Q.R (WHITE)
description:
S.P.Q.R (trans. The Senate & the People of Rome) zipper tee.

Handmade/Cut & Sew. 

"Its amazing actually gazing through these pictures just to see how these tees actually came into fruition. We wanted to completely shift focus and have a big distance in between our Spring collection and this one. So we went under into Pre-fall intermission. Handmade/Cut & Sew.

Designed by Shek Tarawallie & Christofer Brito. 
Photos by An Dukes.

name: 'Saturn Devours his Son' by Francisco de Goya
description:
[Tee Shirt] 


'This is a painting that basically demands everyones respect. No matter who you are our where you see this painting, it is bound to provoke some sort of reaction from you. It is gruesome. It is provocative. Even more so if you are sitting next to someone who is wearing it. But apart from the obvious things that the naked eye provides, Goya captures the Greek (Romanised) myth of Saturn, the father of time. He feared that he would be overthrown by one of his children, so he ate each one as soon as they were born. This shirt made my little sister cry when she saw it for the first time. It was at that moment that I knew, Christofer Brito (who wanted to use this painting), had a genius idea. Very few paintings provoke that much emotion upon site. We are trying to bring you Goya's masterpiece in high definition and I do believe we succeeded.'


- Creative Director, Shek Tarawallie


Divine quality of couture standards.
Dry clean only.
Fits slim, European.
Original artwork by Francisco de Goya.
Designed by Christofer Brito

name: Thirty Year War.
description:
[Tee Shirt]

'You ever feel like you were in a 1600s and that you were fighting everyone around you?....no? Well, luckily for you are not a fashion designer. It is a tough, tough world out here guys. It is especially difficult when you are completely independent with every odd stacked up against you to succeed. Yes, I do feel as if I am at war with the fashion world. Luckily I have a couple thousand troops all over the world that are doing there best to make sure that we stake our claim.'

- Creative Director, Shek Tarawallie 

100% Soft touch quality.
Three day dyeing process.
Each shirt is dyed by human hand.

Designed by Shek Tarawallie.

name: 'Conflict with Napoleon's Austrian fleet.' by Friedrich L'Allemand
description:
'Napoleon was a pretty powerful man in case you have never heard of him. His conquest to take over the entire world probably would have been completed if he would have avoided the Russian winter. The fact that other armies had skirmishes with miscellaneous fleets under his rule is not surprising, but it is almost expected. In fashion, no matter who you are or how big of a figure you are, it always seems inevitable that skirmishes will occur. But, unlike Napoleon we don't attack anything or anyone and our dominance will resonate not as tyrants but as creators and architects of innovation.'

- Creative Director, Shek Tarawallie 

100% Soft touch quality.
Three day dyeing process.
Each shirt is dyed by human hand.
Original artwork by Friedrich L'Allemand
Designed by Shek Tarawallie.

name: 'Emblems of the Civil War' by Alexander Pope
description:
[Satin Dress shirt]

'I think when you are designing a collection, it is very very important to find a theme very early on. This painting was one of the first ideas that we had for this collection. It was originally going to be a tee shirt, but Shek was pushing for more, for something that was completely unorthodox from what we have done. I came up with this as an initial design and concept. I had no actual idea whether or not we could pull it off, or whether or not the dye could sublimate properly. This was our one chance to do something Versace-isk and we took it and ran with it.'

- Artistic Director, Christofer Brito

Original artwork by Alexander Pope 
Designed by Christofer Brito
Crafted & Sewn by hand.
100% Satin.

name: D.O.A
description:
'This piece gave us the biggest headache ever. The process to make this happen is dye-sublimation. Unfortunately, we have no control over dye or how it spreads sometimes. This crew neck was the cause for the collection to be split in half. I knew that it had to come out an it had to be perfect! The sweater depicts how death caught Alexander of guard after he had punctured his lung. His statute dissolving into the pit of smoke symbolizes death as a force. He was a mortal after all.'

- Creative Director, Shek Tarawallie 


Hand crafted piece by piece.

DRY CLEAN!
